required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of BenZalkonium Chloride Gel as Vaginal Contraceptive: a Multicentric Randomized Controlled Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of BenZalkonium Chloride Gel as Vaginal Contraceptive: a Multicentric Randomized Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Institute of Planned Parenthood Research

collaborator.agency: Shanghai Municipal Commission of Population and Family Planning
International Peace Maternity and Child Health Hospital
Shanghai No. 1 Maternity and Child Care Center

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Institute of Planned Parenthood Research

brief_summary.textblock: A multicentric clinical trial in three Chinese Maternal and Child Hospitals was conducted to evaluate the efficacy, safety and acceptability of newly-developed vaginal contraceptive gel, the optimized benzalkonium chloride (BZK) gel containing 18mg BZK, with comparison to a currently marketed (in China)contraceptive gel LELEMI® containing 50mg Nonoxynol-9 (N-9).

detailed_description.textblock: A phase II, multicentric,randomized, controlled clinical trial.

arm_group.description: 120 subjects using BenZalkonium Chloride Contraceptive Gel

intervention.intervention_name: a novel Benzalkonium Chloride (BZK) contraceptive gel
intervention.description: insert 1 piece of the gel (containing 18mg BZK) into vagina before every coital act.
insert 1 piece ofLELEMI® contraceptive gel within half an hour before every coital act

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- at risk for pregnancy and desiring contraception
- having regular menstrual cycle (21-35 days)
- at low risk for HIV or other sexually transmitted infection
- sexually active
- use the test products as their primary method of contraception
- keep a diary of coital activity, product use, and adverse events
Exclusion Criteria:
- diagnosis of any vaginal infection or any symptom of STDs at baseline
- known allergy or hypersensitivity to N-9 or BZK
- menopause for more than one month
- breastfeeding
- vaginal bleeding with unknown reasons
- genitourinary system anomaly
- hysteroptosis II or severe cystocele
- moderate to severe erosion of cervix
- malignant reproductive system tumors

overall_official.affiliation: Shanghai Municipal Commission of Population and Family Planning

facility.name: Gynecology and Obstetrics Hospital of Fudan University
International Peace Maternity and Child Care Center
Shanghai No. 1 Maternity and Child Care Center

responsible_party.organization: Shanghai Institute of Planned Parenthood Research
